content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-162-30-A
|Item_parent=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Item_parent_short=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the clinical manifestations of HPV
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=30}}
Various locations, single or multiple

- Condylomata acuminata: "cocksucker's ridges

- Flat condyloma: pinkish maculo-papules

- Intraepithelial neoplasia (IEN): pre-cancerous lesions (LSIL or HSIL)

question.question: Which of the following is a common clinical manifestation of Human Papillomavirus (HPV) infection?
question.option_a: Condylomata lata, which are flat, moist lesions
question.option_b: Condylomata acuminata, also known as 'cocksucker's ridges'
question.option_c: Flat condyloma, which appear as pinkish maculo-papules
question.option_d: Intraepithelial neoplasia (IEN), which are always cancerous lesions
